Wing Gambit

Mar 24, 2025

The Wing Gambit can be found in multiple opening lines. This page is specifically looking at the Wing Gambit in the Sicilian Defense. It starts with the moves:

  1. e4 c5
  2. b4 White looks to give up the b pawn in exchange for the removal of blackâ€™s dangerous c pawn in the Sicilian Defense. Usually black will take the pawn on b4 and white will continue with a3.

Duckduckgo results about Wing Gambit

In chess, the Wing Gambit is an opening in which White plays an early b4, deflecting an enemy pawn or bishop from c5 so as to regain control of d4, an important central square.
